comprehensive_overview: Message Passing Interface (MPI) is a standardized and portable message-passing system designed to enable scalable, parallel computing on a wide variety of parallel computers. It is widely used in the field of high-performance computing (HPC) to develop parallel programs that can run efficiently on distributed memory architectures.
core_features: Allows communication and data exchange between parallel processes
Supports creation of parallel applications for distributed memory systems
Facilitates coordination and synchronization of parallel tasks
Scalable and efficient for large-scale parallel computing
